docs.lead_paragraph: On the very same day that Democrats swore in Al Franken of Minnesota as their 60th senator -- giving the party at least the theoretical muscle to shut down Republican filibusters -- the majority leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, apparently decided that some of his fellow Democrats were trying too hard to win Republican support for a major overhaul of the health care system.

headline.main: Reid Is Skeptical About Wooing G.O.P. on Health Care

docs.abstract: The majority leader cautions Senator Max Baucus about trying too hard to win bipartisan support for health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: The majority leader cautions Senator Max Baucus about trying too hard to win bipartisan support for health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: A dozen union presidents will meet with President Obama in the White House next Monday to discuss health-care legislation as well as a bill that would make it easier to unionize, labor leaders and administration officials said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Union Leaders to Meet With Obama Next Week

docs.abstract: Presidents of the nation's major unions will attend a White House summit on labor issues.
docs.snippet: Presidents of the nation's major unions will attend a White House summit on labor issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Guess we know who's in charge over at the White House while the president is out of town.

headline.main: Obama Overrides Aide on Health Insurance 'Public Option'

docs.abstract: The president reiterates his support for a public health portion of the overhaul.
docs.snippet: The president reiterates his support for a public health portion of the overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent writes in, denouncing my latest column, and says that if things go my way we'll end up with the government providing health care to everyone, which will "destroy the American way of life."

docs.lead_paragraph: Even as he meets with leaders in Russia over reducing the world's nuclear arsenals, President Obama has had to face the split-screen reality of pop culture as the Michael Jackson memorial service in Los Angeles later on Tuesday dominates the airwaves.

headline.main: The Early Word: From Moscow to L.A.

docs.abstract: The president speaks about shared interests between Russia and the United States, but coverage back home continues to be dominated by Jackson.
docs.snippet: The president speaks about shared interests between Russia and the United States, but coverage back home continues to be dominated by Jackson.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reform should be financed by extracting savings from the bloated health care system, but also by raising revenues from a wider pool, preferably from well-to-do Americans.
docs.snippet: Reform should be financed by extracting savings from the bloated health care system, but also by raising revenues from a wider pool, preferably from well-to-do Americans.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration and hospital associations were working on an agreement that would provide about $150 billion in savings to help pay for an overhaul of the health care system.

headline.main: White House and Hospitals Are Reported to Be Near Deal
headline.print_headline: White House and Hospitals Are Reported to Be Near Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 85 percent of babies born alive in this country each year are assessed by electronic fetal monitoring amid continuing controversy over whether it does more harm than good.

headline.seo: New Guidelines Issued for Fetal Heart Monitoring
